alert.note: Alert for Benton; Buchanan; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 9:19PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A slow-moving thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Linn, southern Buchanan and northeastern Benton Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 918 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a slow-moving thunderstorm over Brandon, or 9 miles south of Independence, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail and minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. Locations impacted include... Center Point, Urbana, Walker, Quasqueton, Brandon, Rowley, Lime Creek County Park, Spencers Grove, Minne Estema Park, and Cheney. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 40 and 54. Rainfall amounts of around 2 to 3 inches have fallen and an additional 1 to 3 inches of rain are possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforecement. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
